subtitle.Text: One of the assets that I really liked creating in the game were these board games. There’s three in total of them throughout the house.
Ideally there’d be more but you know we had to focus on getting the walls built and things like that.
But I really like them, they’re just a simple extruded cube.
There’s something about environment design that’s really fun, a really goofy aspect of it, where you have to create fake brand names, you have to create fake toys and fake storefronts,
maybe my favourite is in the game Costume Quest when you’re going through the shopping mall there’s a store called ‘Why Not Flip Flops’ which always makes me really happy.
But this one is a parody of Dream Phone, which is an awful game that came out in the early 90s where you sit around a table with your girlfriends
and you pick up this plastic pink phone and call these sexy boys and you see which one likes you.
It doesn’ really suit Sam’s personality exactly, but I figure maybe it was given to her by a well intentioned relative who doesn’t quite have her personality down,
and maybe she played it once on a lark and then, you know, put it in the closet and that’s where it stays.
